review_title: Excellent flashlight; batteries don't fit in box
reviews:
Excellent flashlight, with the quality level I've come to expect from Fenix. Impressive brightness for it's size -- but do keep in mind that it cannot sustain maximum brightness continuously, it will gradually decrease (this is well documented).

Minus one star because the batteries don't actually fit in the small plastic box provided in this combo: it's a box for a smaller battery size.

reviews:
I took a star away because the supplied battery case can‚Äôt hold the rechargeable batteries that came with this flashlight. Definitely useless, not a deal breaker though.

I have owned the older fenix (pd35 I think) since 2010/2011 and it‚Äôs still going strong. I ordered this for the extra brightness and rechargeable batteries.

From what I understand the batteries aren‚Äôt the standard size according to some reviews. So I ordered this (x2 battery) set with the assumption these will be the only batteries I will use until they fail.

So far it‚Äôs an excellent flashlight, no issues and seems of similar quality to my older fenix flashlight (which has withstood harsh environments and abuse). I‚Äôm hoping this will last years to come as well.

‚ÄîVery bright for the size
‚ÄîSeems very well built
‚ÄîVery useful eco mode for extended use
‚ÄîUpside USB-C charging
-Downside charging one battery at a time w/flashlight. Doesn‚Äôt come w/extra charger.
‚ÄîVery easy/simple to use

-Will update if needed.

review_title: Too many problems with this light
reviews:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.
 The first one I order worked fine, but only for a short while. After a few months of light use, the constant-on function would no longer work, it was stuck in momentary only. I paid for shipping and sent it back under warranty. The replacement light I received was even worse than the original. The light would constantly flicker on and off, and often times would not switch through light modes, even after trying 3 different fully charged batteries. Customer service with EdisonBright tells me ‚Äú It is highly unusual to have such problem in two lights,‚Äù and they don‚Äôt seem to want to replace the second faulty light sent to me.
Do yourself a favor, and buy a Streamlight or Surefire.

reviews: Excellent flashlight! I now use this as my patrol duty flashlight. It is extremely bright and has both good throw and good spill. In turbo mode it lights everything up bright. I like it so much I ordered a second to keep in my personal vehicle or for edc. I subtracted 1 point only because if you shut it off in a lower power mode and then turn it on again it reverts back to that lower position. I would prefer it to always start in turbo for tactical reasons then step it down if I need to.

reviews: A very good light, however, the batteries can't be charged in any 3rd party charger because they are too big. They claim to be "21700" size, which means 21mm diameter and 70mm long. However, they are actually 76mm long, and won't fit in any charger meant for 21700 batteries, so the only way to charge the batteries is inside the flashlight.

reviews: I use this thing daily at work. I use the 30 lumen eco for the majority of things but switch to high when I need to inspect seriously. I rarely use the turbo mode but it works really well. The battery lasts me ages like this. I don't even use the secondary battery. If you were using this continuously in high mode, then the second battery might be useful. I could see that situation in absolute darkness in the woods or something like that. I bought this and the ThruNite TC15 and I prefer the Fenix PD36R by far. The ThruNite is too small and that almost makes it awkward at work. If I was camping, the TC15 would be better because it's so portable with a lot of power. The lumen range works perfect for me on the Fenix. The back button is so much better and I never accidentally turn it on. The TC15 on a belt in my work would come on all the time. The TC15 requires you to hold to toggle modes. I don't like that, I prefer the Fenix where there are two buttons, one controls mode and the other is on/off. A little pricey but well worth it imo.
product_name: Fenix PD36R 1600 Lumen Rechargeable Tactical Flashlight, Additional 5000 mAh Battery bundle

review_title: Amazing piece of engineering packed into this beautiful sturdy aluminum housing.
reviews: I only give the battery life a 4 star because I have yet to rate it based on purchase date,to include the fact I owned a PD35 that runs off the 18650 Batteries and one the cell pretty much failed after about 8 - 10 charging cycles. However this New PD36R is like the perfect light, throwed settings is ideal for most applications like inspections etc. being I'm a mechanic. Then the ability to increase the brightness with the press of a button is awesome.. it's beam extends beyond what I even expected and covers a pretty wide area also. One of the best things about it also is that you can leave the batter in the light housing and charge it via Type-C usb, no need for external chargers unless you plan on having backup batteries in sets readily available. Just be a little cautious as, when on Max output the top part of the housing tends to get a little warmer than usua almost hot, nonetheless the lens remain intact abd true. It's like the best light I've owned thus far I'm100% happy with the purchase.

reviews:
This thing is BRIGHT. I like the new battery style, the light isn't in anyway noticeably larger than other models. It's pretty low profile but the output is clearly noticeable.

The only downside is the battery life on higher settings is a bit lower than what they imply. There is a notice on the turbo setting that it includes when it automatically lowers the output if the battery gets too low so I'm not really sure how much time you actually get from it. I usually use on the high if I'll be using for an extended time.

But given the size and single battery that's not much of a surprise.

reviews:
I couldn't wait to get this flashlight because my previous 1000 lumen Fenix light got stolen out of my car on Monday. This light was everything I hoped it would be and more. The huge battery will last several months for me. I know that because I own another brand flashlight that has the same exact battery and I've only charged it once since January. This flashlight is bright, bright enough that I can find addresses from my car as I"m slowly driving down the street. I also like the clip and I was able to clip it over my belt and I was not afraid of it slipping off.

Previous reviews stated that the included battery carrying case was too small. Mine was the correct size and two batteries will fit in the case.

This flashlights battery was already charged out of the box and ready to light my way. Very thankful for that as I was at work when I Picked it up and I was able to use it for a few hrs at my job.

Very happy with this purchase.
